purpose: The email announces a two-year postdoctoral position in Empirical Software Engineering at Aarhus University, focusing on the adoption of human-centered AI in software engineering. It highlights the collaboration with industry and the research opportunities available, particularly in the context of Large Language Models. The position requires a PhD in a related field and emphasizes the importance of research experience in applied AI.
evidence_sentences: The Section for Software Engineering and Computing Systems, at the Department of Electrical and Computer Engineering (ECE), invites applicants for a two-year postdoctoral position within the area of Empirical Software Engineering (EMSE).
This position is funded by Innovation Fund Denmark Grand Solutions project "AI4SE1DK - Human-Centered Adoption of Artificial Intelligence for Software Engineering in Denmark".
The project will give you access to a rich ecosystem of researchers and practitioners, opportunities to publish in high-impact venues, and real-world validation of your research.
Applicants should hold a PhD degree in Computer Science or related field.
Solid research experience in applied AI, and in particular with Large Language Models.
